data.title: Saskatchewan
data.meta_description: Map Town is Canada's largest map store. With over 85,000 maps, globes, atlases, guide and more to choose from, you will find what you need to travel anywhere on earth. We sell maps of all sorts including hiking maps, travel maps of countries and local areas, maps of cities, provinces, states and countries, World display maps, topographic maps of Canada, Aeronautical maps, and Nautical maps for sailing the world. We compliment our maps with travel guides, compasses, solar globes, bar globes, floor and desktop globes and gifts. We also offer services such as custom mapping, framing, laminating, reproduction, plotting, and more. We have retail, online and wholesale operations. Serving Canada and the World since 1989.
data.text:
Saskatchewan Geological Highway Map

Our Price: $7.95

Saskatoon Travel Road map

Our Price: $8.95

Regina, Moose Jaw & Swift Current City map

Our Price: $8.95

Saskatchewan Geological Highway Map. This comprehensive geological road map shows highways and the types of surface bedrock, sediment and land forms. Features photographs and explanations of geological features shown including a glossary of terms. A must have for anyone interested in geology in Saskatchewan. Saskatoon Travel Road map. Includes regional map of Saskatchewan Detailed city maps of Battleford, Humboldt, La Ronge, Lloydminster, Martensville, Meadow Lake, Melfort, Nipawan, North Battleford, Prince Albert, Tisdale, Warman and Yorkton. Folded maps have been the trusted standard for years, offering unbeatable accuracy and reliability at a great price. Detailed indices make for quick and easy location of destinations. It's a must-have for anyone travelling in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Regina, Moose Jaw & Swift Current City map. Introducing the Ultimate City Map for Regina, Moose Jaw & Swift Current. Are you tired of relying on smartphone apps or struggling with oversized paper maps? Look no further! Our folded city map is the trusted standard for navigating the Regina, Moose Jaw, and Swift Current area. With unbeatable accuracy and reliability, it's the perfect companion for travelers and locals alike.

One of the standout features of our map is its detailed indices, which make locating destinations quick and effortless. No more wasting time searching for addresses or landmarks! Simply consult the index, and you'll find your desired location in no time.

The map covers a wide range of communities, including Estevan, Kindersley, Melville, Moose Jaw, Regina, Swift Current, Weyburn, and Yorkton. Whether you're exploring the vibrant city life or venturing into the beautiful surrounding areas, our map has you covered.

But it doesn't stop there! Our map is packed with valuable information to enhance your experience. From parks and golf courses to points of interest, arenas, schools, libraries, and community centers, you'll have a comprehensive overview of the region's offerings. No matter what you're looking for, our map will guide you to your desired destination.

What sets our city map apart is its convenience and affordability. Unlike digital alternatives, you won't have to worry about battery life or spotty internet connections. Our foldable design allows for easy storage and retrieval, making it a hassle-free tool for all your adventures. And at an unbeatable price, it's a must-have for anyone traveling or residing in the Regina/Moose Jaw area.

Trust the reliability and accuracy of our folded city map to navigate your way through Regina, Moose Jaw, Swift Current, and the surrounding communities. It's time to embrace the tried-and-true method of paper maps and experience the convenience they offer. Get your copy of the Ultimate City Map today and unlock a world of possibilities!

Our Price: $8.95

Western Canada travel & road map

Our Price: $8.95

585 USA West & Canada West road map

Our Price: $14.95

Saskatchewan travel & road map. Regional maps include Battleford, Estevan, Lloydminster, Moose Jaw, North Battleford, Prince Albert, Regina, Saskatoon, Swift Current, Weyburn and Yorkton. Also includes downtown maps of Prince Albert, Regina and Saskatoon. Detailed indices make for quick and easy location of destinations. It is a must have for anyone travelling in Saskatchewan. Includes a detailed Saskatchewan provincial map with community index, and distance chart. Western Canada travel & road map. Features detailed provincial maps of British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba Regional maps of Calgary, Edmonton, Regina, Saskatoon, Vancouver and Winnipeg. This map offers unbeatable accuracy and reliability at a great price. Detailed indices make for quick and easy location of destinations. It's a must-have for anyone travelling in western Canada. This map comes folded. 585 USA West & Canada West road map. MICHELIN Western USA, Western Canada Regional Map scale 1:2,400,000 will provide you with an extensive coverage of primary, secondary and scenic routes for this region. In addition to Michelin's clear and accurate mapping, this regional map includes all the practical information for a trouble free journey, including major town plans as well as tourism information to make the most of your journey. With MICHELIN Regional Maps, find more than just your way!

Canada Political Road map

Our Price: $16.95

Canada Central National Geographic Adventure Map

Our Price: $19.95

Canada Political Road map - folded. Each province and territory is shown in a different colour. This is a great overall map of Canada in a folded version showing the Trans Canada Highway. Durable paper. Double sided, reverse shows 10 insets with added detail. Scale 1:6,000,000 South Saskatchewan River Canoe Map - Estuary to SK Landing. Map number three in the series. Shows where it's safe to canoe and where you might need to portage. Scale 1:150,000.

Topographic map of the Saskatchewan river from Estuary to Lake Diefenbaker in SK. Size 41 inches x 12 inches. National Geographic's Canada Central AdventureMap is designed to meet the needs of adventure travelers with its durability and detailed, accurate information. The map includes the locations of cities and towns with a user-friendly index, a clearly marked road network complete with distances and designations for roads/highways, plus secondary routes for those seeking to explore off the beaten path for destinations between Alberta and Ontario.

South Saskatchewan River Canoe Map - Saskatoon to Batoche

Our Price: $19.95

The Palliser Expedition Map 1857-60 - Reproduction

Our Price: $19.95

South Saskatchewan River Canoe Map - Saskatoon to Batoche. Map of Canoe routes South Saskatchewan 5, Saskatchewan. scale 1:100,000.

Topographic map of the South Saskatchewan river from Saskatoon to Batoche in Saskatchewan. Scale 1:100,000 size 14" x 41". Saskatchewan River Canoe Map - Batoche to N. SK River. Canoe routes of the South Saskatchewan River in Saskatchewan. This topographic map runs from Batoche to the North Saskatchewan River. The size of this map is 14" x 41". The Palliser Expedition Map 1857-60 - Reproduction. This reproduction map is one of the most important maps of Western Canada with respect to early pre-Canadian history. Measures 14 inches tall by 54 inches wide.

BACKGROUND

The Palliser Expedition (British North American Exploring Expedition), 1857-60, was initiated by John Palliser, who submitted to the Royal Geographical Society a plan to travel from Red River Colony to and through the Rocky Mountains along the unsurveyed American boundary. The society expanded the project into a scientific expedition and applied for a grant of L5000 from the imperial government, which was then facing the problem of the future of the Hudson's Bay Company's territories and badly needed information about them. To exploration of the plains south of the north Saskatchewan River and southern passes through the Rockies, the Colonial Office added an examination of the old North West Company canoe route west from Lake Superior. Under Palliser's command, Dr James Hector was appointed geologist and naturalist, Eug√®ne Bourgeau botanical collector and John W. Sullivan secretary and astronomical observer. Magnetical observer Lt Thomas W. Blakiston brought his delicate instruments via Hudson Bay to join them on the prairies.

The explorers amassed astronomical, meteorological, geological and magnetic data, and described the country, its fauna and flora, its inhabitants and its "capabilities" for settlement and transportation. They concluded that to establish a "communication" entirely within British territory from Canada to Red River would be difficult and costly; access through American territory was much easier. Although some semiarid country (which is now known as "Palliser's Triangle") stretched across the American border into the prairies of modern Canada, it was surrounded by a "fertile belt" well suited for stock raising and agriculture. There were deposits of coal and other minerals.

The party traversed 6 passes in the southern Rockies, some of them feasible for a railway (the CPR was later built through one of them. Kicking Horse Pass, named by Hector), but found the mountains farther west a formidable obstacle. The expedition's reports (published in 1859, 1860 and 1863) and its comprehensive map (1865) were for some time the major source of information about the sweep of country from Lake Superior to BC's Okanagan Valley, and are still of value today.

Western & Northern Canada Travel Atlas

Our Price: $21.95

Grasslands East National Park Map - East Block

Our Price: $22.95

Western & Northern Canada Travel Atlas. Travel atlas of Western and Northern Canada. Includes British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Yukon, Northwest Territories and Nunavut. South Saskatchewan River Canoe Map - CFB to Red Deer River. Map of Canoe routes South Saskatchewan 2, Saskatchewan. Scale 1:75,000.

Topographic map of the South Saskatchewan river from the Canadian Forces base to Saskatchewan. Scale 1:75,000. Size 41" x 15". Grasslands East National Park Map - East Block. This is a folded paper map with shaded topographic relief for the eastern portion of Grasslands National Park in Saskatchewan, Canada. Shows hiking and mountain biking trails, car tours through the National Park and campsites. Comes complete in its own protective plastic sleeve. Measures 40 Inches by 24 Inches. Scale is 1:50,000.

Churchill River #7 - Otter Lake Saskatchewan Hiking map

Our Price: $22.95

Churchill River #7 - Otter Lake Saskatchewan Hiking map. This is a topographic map of the Otter Lake area in Northern Saskatchewan, Canada. The map measures 30 inches by 20 inches and features a UTM grid to aid with navigation. It is specifically designed for hiking in the area and provides detailed information on the terrain, trails, and other features of the region. This map is part of the larger Churchill River #7 series of maps that cover various areas along the Churchill River in Saskatchewan. The Otter Lake map is particularly useful for those planning hiking trips in the region and provides important information to ensure a safe and enjoyable experience. Churchill River #6 - Trout to Otter Lake SK canoe map. The Churchill River map is a must-have tool for anyone planning a canoe trip in the Trout Lake to Otter Lake area of North Central Saskatchewan, Canada. The map measures 41" x 21" and covers a large area, connecting to the Sandfly to Trout Lake map to the west, providing a comprehensive view of the region.

One of the key features of the Churchill River map is the suggested canoe route. This route has been carefully selected to provide canoeists with the best possible experience in the area. The map provides detailed information on portages, rapids, and other hazards, making it easier for canoeists to plan their routes and avoid potential dangers.

In addition to the suggested canoe route, the Churchill River map also provides information on other important features such as campsites, access points, and parking areas. This information is essential for anyone planning a canoe trip as it helps to ensure that you have everything you need for a safe and enjoyable trip.

Overall, the Churchill River map is an essential resource for anyone planning a canoe trip in the Trout Lake to Otter Lake area of North Central Saskatchewan. Its large size and detailed information on suggested canoe routes, portages, campsites, and access points make it an invaluable tool for any canoeist looking to explore the area.

Churchill River #5 - Sandfly to Trout Lake canoe map. The Sandfly to Trout Lake map is an essential tool for anyone planning a canoe trip in North Central Saskatchewan, Canada. The map covers a large area and is sized 45" x 22", providing a comprehensive view of the region. It joins onto the Trout to Otter Lake map to the east, making it easier for canoeists to plan their trips across multiple maps.

One of the key features of the Sandfly to Trout Lake map is the suggested canoe routes. These routes have been carefully selected to provide canoeists with the best possible experience in the area. The map provides detailed information on portages, rapids, and other hazards, making it easier for canoeists to plan their routes and avoid potential dangers.

In addition to the suggested canoe routes, the Sandfly to Trout Lake map also provides information on other important features such as campsites, access points, and parking areas. This information is essential for anyone planning a canoe trip as it helps to ensure that you have everything you need for a safe and enjoyable trip.

Overall, the Sandfly to Trout Lake map is an essential resource for anyone planning a canoe trip in North Central Saskatchewan. Its large size and detailed information on suggested canoe routes, portages, campsites, and access points make it an invaluable tool for any canoeist looking to explore the area.

Churchill River #8 - Otter Lake to Nistowiak canoe map. This is a map of the Missinipe, Otter Lake to Nistowiak Falls area in Saskatchewan, Canada. The map measures 45 inches by 22 inches and provides detailed information about suggested canoe routes in the region. It is designed to be used by paddlers and outdoor enthusiasts who are exploring this area and want to navigate their way safely through the various waterways. The map is particularly useful for planning canoe trips, as it shows the locations of rapids, portages, campsites, and other features of the area. It is a valuable resource for those seeking to explore the beautiful wilderness of Saskatchewan and enjoy all that this region has to offer.

NOTE! Laminated maps will be sent rolled, not folded. South Saskatchewan River Canoe Routes - Gardiner Dam to Saskatoon. Canoe Map showing Saskatchewan river from the Gardiner Dam at the end of Lake Diefenbaker to Saskatoon. Scale 1:100,000 size 20" x 49". Churchill River - Snake Rapids to Sandfly Lake Canoe Map. The suggested canoe route map featuring forest fire burns in North Central Saskatchewan, Canada is a valuable tool for outdoor enthusiasts, specifically those interested in canoeing and exploring the region's natural beauty. With its combination of topographic features, shaded relief, and a scale of 1:50,000, this map offers detailed and accurate information crucial for safe and enjoyable navigation in the area.

One of the primary reasons this map is important is due to its inclusion of forest fire burns. Forest fires are a natural and recurring phenomenon in many wilderness areas, including Saskatchewan. These burns can significantly alter the landscape, impacting both the vegetation and the overall ecosystem. By indicating the areas affected by fires, this map provides valuable information about the current condition of the environment, allowing canoeists to plan their routes accordingly.

Furthermore, the map's topographic features and shaded relief greatly enhance its usefulness. Canoeing in unfamiliar territories requires a thorough understanding of the terrain, including elevation changes, water features, and potential obstacles. The topographic features, such as contour lines and elevation shading, provide canoeists with a visual representation of the landscape's physical characteristics. This information is essential for route planning, enabling paddlers to anticipate challenging sections, identify potential campsites, and make informed decisions about their journey.

The scale of 1:50,000 ensures a high level of detail, allowing for precise navigation and accurate interpretation of the surroundings. The size of the map, measuring 34" x 22", further enhances readability and usability, ensuring that the information remains clear and accessible even during outdoor adventures.

Grasslands West National Park map

Our Price: $23.95

Churchill River Canoe Map 2 - Shagenaw to Knee Lake. The map's topographic features and shaded relief greatly enhance its usefulness. Canoeing in unfamiliar territories requires a thorough understanding of the terrain, including elevation changes, water features, and potential obstacles. Grasslands West National Park map. Folded paper shaded topographic map of the west portion of Grasslands National Park. Located in Saskatchewan, Canada. Includes hiking and mountain biking trails, car tour through the national park, places to stay and campsites. Here's a few notable places in the area -

Frenchman Valley Campground: Offers camping facilities and access to some hiking trails.

Val Marie Visitor Centre: A starting point for information about the park and its attractions.

Hiking Trails: Explore trails like Eagle Butte Trail and 70 Mile Butte Trail for stunning vistas of the prairie.

Rock Creek Campground: Another camping option with scenic views.

Comes complete in its own protective plastic sleeve.

NOTE - Laminated maps will be sent rolled, not folded.

Lake Diefenbaker & Area map

Our Price: $23.95

Lac La Ronge Saskatchewan Canoe map

Our Price: $23.95

Prairie Provinces Base Map 1:2,000,000

Our Price: $24.95
